intro: Meliosma linearifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf meliosma, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its elongated, linear leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. The plant produces small, white, clustered flowers in the spring, which are followed by dark, spherical berries. Its foliage is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive, textured appearance. Meliosma linearifolia prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens.
